detail.content: Showing IV: March 12th-14th: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Dance Chair's Message / Social Undergraduate Graduate Course Offerings News & Events Performances Dance & New Media Live Summer High School Second Avenue Dance Company Alumni Current Students Admin & Faculty  home > Dance        Showing IV: March 12th-14th  Showing IV March 12-14, 8pm 111 2nd Avenue, Fifth Floor Theater    Each year Tisch Dance presents five Showings. These Showings are opportunities for students from both the Bachelor’s and Master’s degree programs to perform and choreograph. Supervised by our experienced faculty, these showings are comprised entirely of student choreographers and serve as a means through which students experiment with different aesthetics, styles, and concepts of dance. Additionally, Showing IV offers choreographers and dancers the opportunity to explore the use of digital and new media as a part of the choreographic process. Lasting around an hour and a half, the Showings are performed with full lights, costumes, are a wonderful display of the individuality, ingenuity, and intelligence of the dancers and choreographers at Tisch. For tickets, reserve online or call the Dance Office at 212-998-1982 between 9am and 4pm M/F. Directing the Actor IV: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Graduate Film Admissions About our Programs  News & Events Showcase Faculty Facilities MBA/MFA Dual Degree The Purple List Facebook TSOA FTV Wiki First Run Festival Cinema Research Institute  home > Graduate Film        Directing the Actor IV  GFMTV-GT.2242 Lecture 2 Credits This class uses classical plays and film scripts as a basis for acting. Focus includes characters, backgrounds, relationship and progression by performance, and the emotional and physical demands of character and improvisation. *Armando Diaz's Spring section This class uses the methods of "Long-Form Improvisation" to teach students an approach to directing and performing in comedy. As well, the class explores the and embraces the concept of "truth in comedy" as it pertains to the principles of Action, Objective and Justification.
